content:
Drug: Fentanyl | cid: 3345
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about Fentanyl including uses, images, dosage, effects, legal status, and links to other resources.
Erowid name: fentanyl
Category: PHARMS
Field: MainPage

                    Text: 
                    Your donation supports practical, accurate info about psychoactive plants & drugs. We accept 9 cryptocurrencies. Contribute a bit today!

Fentanyl



COMMON & BRAND NAMES

China White; Sublimaze (liquid); Duragesic (transdermal patch); Actiq (oral transmucosal "lollipop"); Fentora (buccal)

EFFECTS CLASSIFICATION

Analgesic; Anaesthetic

CHEMICAL NAME

N-(1-phenethyl-4-piperidyl)propionanilide

DESCRIPTION

Fentanyl is a short-acting synthetic opiate analgesic which is active at very low doses. Its effects are compared to heroin and it has been sold on the street as heroin, causing some deaths.

BASICS

EFFECTS

IMAGES

HEALTH

LAW

DOSE

CHEMISTRY

GENERAL INFORMATION #

Fentanyl Bits & Pieces

RELATED VAULTS #

Opiates Vault

Heroin Vault

Triple Header, by BlackPanther

Patch Overdose and Four Day Hell, by TMG

Solution to all Problems, by Serotone

From Relaxing to Overdose to Withdrawal, by Dinar Narlad

» » » MORE » » »


                    Context: 
                    This excerpt provides detailed information on fentanyl, a potent synthetic opioid, including its common brand names, classification, chemical name, and a brief description of its effects and risks. It is part of the larger drugs and pharmaceuticals database, serving as a focused entry within the extensive Fentanyl section that includes links to related vaults, experiences, and further resources, essential for research or educational purposes.

SECONDARY RESOURCES #

MEDIA COVERAGE #

DOJ indicts Chinese fentanyl distributors selling to Americans online - Ars Technica, Oct 17 2017

Fentanyl is not a problem. Drug laws are the problem - American Thinker, Dec 15 2016

Prince died from fentanyl overdose, Jun 2, 2016, Minneapolis Star Tribune

Brampton man arrested for allegedly importing fentanyl from China, Sep 8, 2015, CBC.ca

Injured US Marines to get 'lollipop' instead of morphine, Nov 1 2011, Telegraph.co.uk

Fentanyl timeline: 1950 through today, Jun 2007, Detroit Free Press

Lollipops & Lawsuits, May 2007, Newsweek

It is relevant for understanding experiential accounts and accessing further information about fentanyl within the broader context of drug information on the webpage.

GOVERNMENT RESOURCES #

fentanyl's increasing flows fuel steep rise in overdose deaths - UNODC, Mar 2017

Pharmaceutical Executives Charged in Racketeering Scheme - DOJ, Dec 8, 2016

Increases in Fentanyl Drug Confiscations and Fentanyl-related Overdose Fatalities - CDC, Oct 26, 2015

DEA Issues Nationwide Alert on Fentanyl as Threat to Health and Public Safety, Mar 28 2015

FDA approved fentanyl oral transmucosal tablets, Jan 7 2011

Fentanyl Patch Recall, Mar 1 2008

U.S. DOJ Situation Report: Fentanyl (June 2006)
